value.title: DAX Fridays #201: How to create virtual tables using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video I will show you how you create virtual tables in DAX to do calculations on them.   Happy Friday!  The  sample file is available for download here: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  SUBSCRIBE to learn more about Power and Excel BI! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJ7UhloHSA4wAqPzyi6TOkw?sub_confirmation=1

value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. As you are limited to one active relationship, we need to use the DAX function USERELATIONSHIP to manage the inactive relationships.  Link to Power BI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/userelationship-dax

value.title: DAX Fridays! #24: Running/ Cumulative totals (w Pareto chart)
value.excerpt: In this video I will show you how to calculate cumulative totals or running totals with DAX/ powerpivot.  We will calculate running totals with a Date and with another column (not a date).  Link to Matt's Blog post: http://exceleratorbi.com.au/cumulative-running-total-based-on-highest-value/  Link to

value.title: DAX for Power BI - Calculate Cumulative Sum (Running Total) of Count in Power BI
value.excerpt: The cumulative total is also known as Running total and during this video, we will talk about how we can calculate a cumulative sum for request count using Power BI Dax measure in Power BI.  During this session, we will cover the following things: • Real-life example where we need Cumulative Sum 00:21

value.title: Power BI Shows Incorrect Measure Total? How to fix it?
value.excerpt: During this session, we will try to resolve one of the most common issues that occur in Power BI Desktop which is Incorrect Measure Total issue for table or matrix visual. Sometimes, we have multiple tables in our report and we have prepared some DAX expression to calculate some values in our report.

value.title: DAX Measures: Filter Context Explained in Simple Terms using the I.C.A.N. Principle
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” using the 4-easy step approach of the I.C.A.N. Principle. ==  I. Incoming Filters ==  C. CALCULATE does it’s Magic! ==  A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)

value.title: Customer Retention in Power BI   DAX Measures
value.excerpt: Customer retention is one of the most common scenarios of data analysis, which is very useful for business. As a business, you would like to know how many new customers you have in each month, how many returning,  and how many lost customers. Knowing these, would help you to focus on the growth plan,

value.title: Get the Day of the Week Name and Number in Power BI Using DAX
value.excerpt: If you don't have a date table with a column that represents the day of the week name (Saturday, Sunday, Monday etc) or number (from zero to six, or from one to seven), and you just have a date field, which you want to quickly get the day name of the week, here is a quick trick for you. Read my blog

value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #02: Add single column filter

value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Using OR conditions between slicers in DAX
value.excerpt: How to implement a logical OR condition between two slicers of a Power BI report, or of a PivotTable in Excel. By default, when relying on more than one slicer they are considered in an AND condition. This video+article explains how to change this behavior using DAX.  Article and sample download: https://sql.bi/66373?aff=yt

value.title: Using USERELATIONSHIP in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to use the USERELATIONSHIP function in DAX to change the active relationship in a CALCULATE function. Article and download: https://sql.bi/664175

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: Dynamic Rolling Average with DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Create a dynamic 7 day or 30 day rolling average wiht DAX What-IF parameters with ease. Create a dynmaic dashboard board that provides immedicate insight.   Check me out on Linkedin: www.linkedin.com/in/gaelimholland

value.excerpt: The DAX function ISINSCOPE, allow us to work with hierarchies in Power BI. In this video I will go through an example on how to do that.
